markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Bola](/Weapons.aspx?ID=331)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Nonlethal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=188" />
<trait label="Ranged Trip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=251" />
<trait label="Thrown" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=195" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 30 <sup>1.1</sup>, [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 120 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 248 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Favored Weapon** [Grandmother Spider](/Deities.aspx?ID=37), [Mahathallah](/Deities.aspx?ID=170)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 5 sp

**Damage** 1d6 B

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

**Range** 20 ft.

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Martial

**Group** [Sling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=13)
</row>

</column>

---

This throwing weapon consists of weights tied to the end of long cords, which can be used to entangle foes.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-13" />
name: Bola
